New Records: RJ Barrett had his first triple-double — 25 points, 15 assists and 10 rebounds, the first Raptors player ever with all that in the same game.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum hit a 3-pointer at the buzzer in overtime and the Boston Celtics rallied to beat the Toronto Raptors 126-123 on Saturday night.
Toronto won a coach’s challenge on an out-of-bounds call that originally was awarded to Boston.
Neemias Queta scored a driving layup on the Celtics’ next possession.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics improved to 11-3 and avoided losing for the third time at TD Garden this season.
The Raptors entered with Scottie Barnes (orbital fracture) and Bruce Brown (right knee) on the mend.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics rallied to beat the Toronto Raptors 126-123 on Saturday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Raptors outscored the Celtics 76-42 in the paint.
Boston gave up 68 points to Atlanta during its NBA Cup loss to the Hawks earlier this week.
Others: Bruno Fernando was helped off the court in the second quarter after landing awkwardly on a teammate’s foot while pulling down a rebound.
